fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63257].
  {panel}

Plannified log scanning reports sent by mails could be usefull, but the way they are, i endend up not looking them anymore.

This is because the log rotation size is a lot bigger than my daily logs. As a result, i receive a daily mail of warnings that mostly occured some weeks ago and were already handled. But there is no indicatinon of occurence date for the warnings. I can't know if there is a new warning unless I go everyday to look for each of the warnings mentionned in the mail to check if they occured recently, or i they are just relics of the older logs!

In the support tools of the admin pages, log analyser report show the last occurence of each warning. That information would also be usefull in the mail, telling me when i need to go look for more information. But only the raw list of warnings is in the mail, with no indication of occurence dates.

Even better, (but maybe not fitted for all cases), could'nt there be an option for the plannified scanning, to remove from the mail report the warnings that occured before the N last days/scans? Or the option to logrotate atlassian-jira.log after a scan, so the  next report only show what happened since the last scan?
fields.summary: Adding date of warning occurence to plannified logs scanning mail

fields.description:
h2. Problem:

Viewing the subtask in Project > Issues > Parent issue, the subtask image isn't available. However viewing the issue detail page of parent issue shows the subtask image correctly. 
h2. Steps to Reproduce:
 # Create an issue and add a subtask on it (More > Create Sub-Task)
 # Resolve the subtask
 # Go back to the parent issue and you will notice that there's a check image before the summary of the subtask
 # Go to Project > Issues > Parent Issue > Subtask and notice that the check image beside the the subtask isn't there

h2. Expected Result

Image should be visible on both scenario
h2. Actual Result

Check image beside the subtask isn't present on the Project > Issues > Parent Issue > Subtask view. It's empty.
h2. Environment:
 * Issue is reproducible in JIRA 7.1.1
 * Cannot replicate in JIRA 7.2.5

h2. Diagnosis:

Notice the difference in the URL for both scenario.  

 [http://atlassian:8080/projects/images/icons/accept.png|http://jira:8080/projects/images/icons/accept.png] for Project > Issues > Parent Issue > Subtask (not working)

[http://atlassian:8080/images/icons/accept.png|http://jira:8080/images/icons/accept.png] for issue detail page (working)
fields.summary: Subtask Image Inconsistency
VMWare Document Deadlink

h3. Problem Definition
In some environments, both POP and IMAP are restricted from external access, however authentication through 'RPC over HTTP' or ActiveSync are allowed

This can prevent Cloud Customers from being able to setup Custom Mail Handlers with their Exchange Servers

h3. Suggested Solution
Include an option within the JIRA mail handlers to authenticate to Exchange Servers using 'RPC over HTTP' or ActiveSync 
 
h3. Workaround 
Allow POP(s) or IMAP(s) protocols

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63246].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behavior

Links between issues in separate JIRA instances show up in the Issue Links section even if the user viewing the issue does not have permission to view the issue in the remote JIRA instance. When two issues in the same instance are linked, the issue link will not be visible if the user does not have the ability to view the linked issue.
 * This can be seen on jira.atlassian.com. JRA-62412 is an example.
 * The ability to view remote links is currently expected behavior according to JRA-31360 

h3. Suggested Behavior

Make it so that issue links to remote JIRA issues do not show if the user does not have the ability to view the issue in the remote instance.
 * Note: A complete solution will include resolving JRA-28511 so that the link does not show in the history.
fields.summary: Hide issue links to issues in remote JIRA instances when user not able to view remote issues
Add columns to the "Issue Links" pane on jira issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When exporting JIRA's issues by the search results (Issues > Search for Issues), the application will export everything. By standard, this should not allow you to export more than 1000 issues (JIRA Administration > System > General Configuration > Advanced > _jira.search.stable.max.results_). Adding this flag (_jira.search.views.default.max=1000_) to _jira-config.properties_ in JIRA's Home is ignored by the application
h3. Steps to Reproduce
h5. On JIRA 7.2.x
 # Ensure to have more than 1000 issues in your instance
 # Access the issue navigator and search for all of them
 # Export these issues to Excel/CSV

h3. Expected Behavior

The application should not export more than 1000 issues or the set value from _jira.search.stable.max.results_.
h3. Actual Behavior

All the issues are exported
Please also note: for large JIRA instances, due to large export this can trigger another problem - JRASERVER-66555
h3. Workaround
h5. Temporary
 # Click on _export_ > Right click on _Copy link address_
 # Paste the URL into the URL bar of a new browser tab.
 # Change the tempMax parameter to the number of issues you want as the example below:
 ** [http://jiraipaddress:8080/contextpath/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-excel-all-fields/temp/SearchRequest.xls?jqlQuery=project+%3D+My&tempMax=50_].

^In the example ahead, I'm exporting the first 50 issue to excel (all fields) for the project "My"^
h5. Definitive

Add URL re-write rules to the front-end reverse-proxy:
 * For exports of search results (JQL queries):
 ## Match the below patterns:
{code:java}
/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-excel-current-fields/temp/SearchRequest.xls?jqlQuery=
/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-csv-current-fields/temp/SearchRequest.csv?jqlQuery=
{code}

 ## Re-write the URL to add the following to the end:
{code:java}
&tempMax=1000
{code}

 * For exports of saved filters:
 ## Match the below patterns:
{code:java}
/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-excel-current-fields/<filter-id>/SearchRequest-<filter-id>.xls
/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-csv-current-fields/<filter-id>/SearchRequest-<filter-id>.csv
{code}
(!) Note that {{<filter-id>}} can be any numeric value starting from 10000.

 ## Re-write the URL to add the following to the end:
{code:java}
?tempMax=1000
{code}

h5. Definitive - Only Blocks Users from Exporting if &tempMax=value is not Manually Added to the URL

(!) Please understand this *has not been thoroughly tested*, we recommend validating the changes on a staging environment before applying into production.
 # Under {{<[JIRA_INSTALL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Installation+Directory]>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/system-issueviews-plugin.xml}}, look for the below lines;
{code:xml|bgColor=#f8f8f8}
<search-request-view key="searchrequest-excel-all-fields" i18n-name-key="admin.issue.views.searchrequest.plugin.excel.all.html" name="Excel" class="com.atlassian.jira.issue.views.SearchRequestExcelViewAllFields" state='enabled' fileExtension="xls" contentType="application/vnd.ms-excel" excludeFromLimitFilter="true">

<search-request-view key="searchrequest-excel-current-fields" i18n-name-key="admin.issue.views.searchrequest.plugin.excel.current.html" name="Excel" class="com.atlassian.jira.issue.views.SearchRequestExcelViewCurrentFields" state='enabled' fileExtension="xls" contentType="application/vnd.ms-excel" excludeFromLimitFilter="true">

<search-request-view key="searchrequest-csv-all-fields" i18n-name-key="admin.issue.views.searchrequest.plugin.csv.all" name="Excel" class="com.atlassian.jira.issue.views.csv.SearchRequestCsvViewAllFields" state='enabled' fileExtension="csv" contentType="text/csv" excludeFromLimitFilter="true">

<search-request-view key="searchrequest-csv-current-fields" i18n-name-key="admin.issue.views.searchrequest.plugin.csv.current" name="Excel" class="com.atlassian.jira.issue.views.csv.SearchRequestCsvViewCurrentFields" state='enabled' fileExtension="csv" contentType="text/csv"  excludeFromLimitFilter="true">

<search-request-view key="searchrequest-charts-view" i18n-name-key="admin.issue.views.plugin.chart.portlet.searchrequestview" name="Charts" class="com.atlassian.jira.issue.views.SearchRequestChartsView" state='enabled' fileExtension="html" contentType="text/html" excludeFromLimitFilter="true">
{code}

 # Backup the original file;
 # Edit the file, removing {{excludeFromLimitFilter="true"}} in all of the above lines;
 # Restart JIRA;

(!) This workaround does prevent users from exporting issues beyond the limit, but user will see a screen with random characters when attempting to do so (see attached image)
fields.summary: Exporting search results does not respect jira.search.stable.max.results and exports all results

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When searching for issues by assignee without using the original letter case in the advanced mode, the *Basic* button will be greyed out. Hence, user is not able to switch to basic search until the JQL is cleared and entered.

h3. Steps to Reproduce the Problem
# Go to the Issue Navigator.
# Use the basic mode to search for issues assigned to a single user. 
#* For example, user 'admin'.
# Switch to the advanced mode. The JQL will be {{assignee in (admin)}}.
# Edit the JQL to change the letters in the username to mixed case or all uppercase. 
#* For example, 'Admin' or 'ADMIN'.
# Enter to search.

h3. Expected result
All issues assigned to user 'admin' will be shown and we can switch to basic search by clicking on the *Basic* button next to the search bar.

h3. Actual result
All issues assigned to user 'admin' will be shown but the *Basic* button next to the search bar is greyed out. We can't use the basic mode until the JQL is cleared and entered.

h3. Workaround
Use the suggested value to auto-complete the username and search
fields.summary: Not able to switch to basic search if we search by a username without following the exact letter case

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63236].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

In my JIRA instance there are two or more custom fields with the same name. I add all of them to a certain screen and want to configure the visible fields via the Edit Issue dialog's _Configure Fields > Show Fields: Custom_ tab. There, only one entry is listed for the respective Custom Field name (e.g., there are three custom fields called 'Team' but in that drop-down I only see one entry called 'Team') which is randomly mapped to just one of the multiple Custom Fields having that name. It is thus not possible to specifically select the custom field to be shown.
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud 1000.552.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have at least two custom fields with the exact same name in your JIRA instance
 # Add all of these custom fields to the edit issue screen of your project (can be any screen, basically)
 # Edit an issue using that screen
 # Try to select just one of your previously added custom fields via _Configure Fields > Show Fields: Custom_

h3. Expected Results

There is an entry for each of my custom fields and I can toggle their visibility individually
h3. Actual Results

There is only one entry for all of my custom fields which toggles the visibility of the first custom field having that name.
h3. Notes

There is a short video illustrating the problem attached to this issue
h3. Workaround

It is possible to at least show _all_ custom fields of that name by switching to _Configure Fields > Show Fields: All_; however, that is not  exactly what you want since you'd actually like to only add one specific custom field to the screen. Alternatively, you can go to the screen configuration in the admin section and hide the fields you do not want from there. This won't work for users without admin permissions, though.
fields.summary: I cannot select my custom field in the Edit Issue dialog's Show Fields tab when there's another field with the same name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63232].
  {panel}

On a Time Tracking Report, selecting "Incomplete Issues Only" hides all issues without time estimates. The expectation is that this should show unresolved issues.

In looking at the Jira issues, I've found JRA-13611, which indicates this is expected. I disagree and feel this is incorrect behavior.

The Time Tracking report is supposed to be able to provide a view of work remaining on a project. There are 2 options to show issues on this report:
"All" - This results in a mess and we have to look at things that are already done or we've decided not to even do.

"Incomplete issues only" - This option seems like it should be exactly what we want in showing unresolved issues. Unfortunately it very unhelpfully hides all issues without time estimates. This makes it difficult to know how much work is left as there isn't a clean way to see which issues don't have time estimates at all.

I understand from the comments on JRA-13611 that the way this was designed was to show anything that has "Remaining time" > 0. Perhaps this is useful to someone, so alternately, please add a new filter such as "Unresolved."
fields.summary: Time Tracking Report Should have an Unresolved filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63226].
{panel}
h3. Summary

Unable to proceed with Project Import due to errors on Custom Field Options. Example:
{quote}The custom field 'Environment' requires option 'Staging' for the import but it does not exist in the current JIRA instance.
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a source instance that has a Select List Custom Field (single choice) with one or more contexts and options
 # Configure the same custom field in a target instance with the same contexts and custom field options
 # Perform Project Import from source to target, using XML backup from source
 # The import is blocked in certain cases

h3. Expected Results

Every project import will go fine
h3. Actual Results

In certain cases, it's not possible to proceed with the import. The below can be seen in the GUI under Custom Fields validation:
{noformat}
The custom field 'Environment' requires option 'Staging' for the import but it does not exist in the current JIRA instance.
{noformat}
h3. Notes

One of the causes is when {{fieldconfiguration.id}} does not match {{fieldconfigscheme.id}}. By rights JIRA should use {{fieldconfiguration.id}} when looking up {{customfieldoption.customfieldconfig}}, but it incorrectly uses {{fieldconfigscheme.id}}, causing the problem. More details can be found in JRASERVER-65734.
h3. Workaround

Refer to [Project Import fails due to missing Custom Field Options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Project+Import+fails+due+to+missing+Custom+Field+Options] for the above problem.
fields.summary: Project Import blocked with an error indicating missing custom field option values for Select List custom field types

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Multiple attachment added when dragging file over the drop area in Firefox 50+
h3. Environment

(!) Only reproduces in Firefox since v 50, previous browsers are not affected.
h3. Steps to reproduce

Captured as a video [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q-9XUT7P49Q] 
 Requirements - JIRA is up and running, has at leat 1 project.
 # Log-in into JIRA
 # Trigger Create issue dialog (Top button Create)
 # Open File viewer and drag the attachment over the drop area

h3. Expected Result

Nothing happens, until drop action is finished
h3. Actual Result

Attachments keeps being added, however the file is not yet dropped onto the drop area.
h3. Notes

Issue occurs only for JIRA versions lower than 7.0.0
h3. Workaround

New version of plugin was rolled out with a fix for older JIRA versions.
 * 6.1-6.2: [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-dnd-attachment-plugin/versions#b156]
 * 6.3-6.4: [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-dnd-attachment-plugin/versions#b146]

It's advised to upgrade to JIRA 7.0 or later.
fields.summary: Multiple attachment added when dragging file over the drop area in Firefox 50+

  {panel}

h3. Summary

Regardless of the users/group set in the _Create Issue_ permission of the Project, an user with the "Modify Reporter" permission can set any user as Reporter of the case, even if that user can't create issues in the Project.
h3. Expected Behavior

The user with the "Modify Reporter" permission should be able to select only users with the "Create Issue" permission.
h3. Actual Behavior

The user with the "Modify Reporter" permission can set any user as _Reporter_ of the issue.
fields.summary: User can add any user from JIRA as reporter

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When running a JIRA upgrade from the JIRA installation folders

h3. Environment
* Linux Server
* JIRA installer .bin

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform a clean JIRA installation
# Download the JIRA installer and place it inside JIRA installation folders
# Run the installer and perform the upgrade
# The upgrade will fail during the process, because the content of the current installation folder will be wiped, with the installation .bin included.

h3. Expected Results
The upgrade wizard should alert the customer not to run from the Installation bin folder.


h3. Actual Results
The installation .bin is deleted along with the content of the bin folder

h3. Notes
It should alert during the installation, or have noted in our documentation not to run upgrades from the installation folder.
fields.summary: JIRA upgrade on Linux will delete the installation files if running from JIRA folder

h3. Problem Definition
Currently Audit logs only state a Workflow was updated once we make any changes to a workflow but there's no information on what exactly was changed.

h3. Suggested Solution
We need to have an audit log to show what exactly has been changed to the workflows, either stating specifically what was changed or at least show the workflow XMLs with the differences highlighted

h3. Summary
Single Level Group By Report is not working as expected In JIRA version 7.0 anf above

h3. Environment
* JIRA version 7.0.0
* JIRA version 7.2.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Few issues with component
# Create a simple filter for the stated projects
# Go to project administration > reports > choose single level group by report
# Choose the filter that was created earlier, under statistic type choose component and click next


h3. Expected Results
The generated reports shows the component name

h3. Actual Results
The generated reports does not show the component name as shown in the image below
!componentname.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
This feature was working fine until JIRA version 6.4.x
fields.summary: Single Level Group By Report Is Not Showing Component Name

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Clicking on the suggestion in the Advanced Search field does not auto-complete the field or the value.

h3. Environment
Chrome browser
* Version 54.0.2840.71 m
* Version 54.0.2840.99 m

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to [jira.atlassian.com|https://jira.atlassian.com].
# Go to the Issue Navigator.
# Use the Advanced mode.
# Type _te_ and there should be a suggestion of the word *text* will appear.
# Click on the suggestion.

h3. Expected result
Clicking on the suggestion will auto-complete the word _text_ in the search bar.

h3. Actual result
Clicking on the suggestion does not auto-complete the word in the search bar.

h3. Workaround
* Instead of clicking on the suggestion, use the arrow key to select the suggestion and click Enter to auto-complete the word.
* Use other browsers than Chrome.
fields.summary: Using Chrome, clicking on the suggestion in the Advanced Search field does not auto-complete the field or the value

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63205].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition:
Currently, we have a pre-configured event to be choose for webhook triggers. When it is triggered, it will send the same information about the changes to the target URL. While there are many options to choose, it is still not possible to set a Custom JSON body to the target URL.

h3. Suggested Solution:
If there is an option to configure a custom JSON body which will be sent out when the webhook is triggered, it will be great. Some external application could use this and there is a possibility that it does not accept the format that JIRA send out.
fields.summary: Custom JSON Body for JIRA Webhooks

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63200].
  {panel}

The description of Schedule Issues permission is "Ability to view or edit an issue's due date."

But this permission is only restricts ability to edit the 'Due Date' of an issue, but not view.

I expect the description to be "Ability to edit an issue's due date."

It also mentioned in the documentation, that nowadays this permission only controls ability to edit the due date.
fields.summary: Misleading description of Schedule Issues permission
Add a tooltip to the Project avatar
Add a tooltip to the Project avatar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63193].
  {panel}

Any gadget that loads in an iframe needs a complete dependency graph for its resources to work.

Some resources require "platform" pieces of javascript – some web-resources that expose libraries or behaviours that everybody should just get, but should not have to explicitly depend upon.

Traditionally, JIRA has provided the superbatch as this "you get these things 'for free' " mechanism.

Gadgets do not include the superbatch.

This means that anything a gadget wants that's in the superbatch it will need to explicitly depend upon.

Amongst those things is an AMD loader.

Manual inclusion of an AMD loader is not scalable and shouldn't be the solution. Automatic inclusion of the loader at a platform level is the desired approach.
fields.summary: Gadgets should always provide an AMD loader

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63192].
  {panel}

Hi,

Our team has been issued the instruction to use a Sandbox project for testing certain issue functions and have been following through.

The issue however is that several widgets & reports are showing their creation/resolution when they shouldnt. We have added "Project != Sandbox" to our filters but that only goes so far.

It would be helpful if there was a way to exclude these "sandbox" projects from widgets, schedules, etc.

Ideally, a flag such as "Exclude from reporting", or "Designate as Sandbox" at the project level would be best.
fields.summary: Allow exclude project(s) from widgets, functions, etc. (sandbox usage)

+Tested On+

Tested this on KUbuntu 16.04 and have a customer also test it on Ubuntu 16.10.

* This is confirmed to work as intended on Ubuntu 14.x

fields.summary: Asana import doesn't work in JIRA 6.2 and 6.3

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA needs to obtain {{DefaultIndexManager}} WriteLock before doing major actions with Lucene index (Full locked reindex, apply index snapshot, apply index from another node in JDC).
In case of Plugin owns the lock, JIRA will never able to get the lock. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA DC with 3+ nodes (problem is not specific to JDC)
# Install plugin which uses {{DefaultIndexManager}} lock. Eg: *Structure*

h3. Expected Results
JIRA is able to run Index operations. 

h3. Actual Results
JIRA is not able to run Index operations. 
The below exception is thrown in the jira.log file:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
2016-10-18 15:38:51,732 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 ERROR      [jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Wait attempt timed out - waited 30000 milliseconds
com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IndexException: Wait attempt timed out - waited 30000 milliseconds
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.obtain(DefaultIndexManager.java:936)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.access$900(DefaultIndexManager.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager$IndexLock.tryLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:1298)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.withReindexLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:375)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.recoverIndexFromBackup(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:124)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService$MessageConsumer.restoreIndex(DefaultIndexCopyService.java:175)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService$MessageConsumer.receive(DefaultIndexCopyService.java:195)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.OfBizMessageHandlerService.sendLocalFromNode(OfBizMessageHandlerService.java:260)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.OfBizMessageHandlerService.handleReceivedMessages(OfBizMessageHandlerService.java:153)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.OfBizMessageHandlerService.access$000(OfBizMessageHandlerService.java:34)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.OfBizMessageHandlerService$1.run(OfBizMessageHandlerService.java:59)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.runAndReset(FutureTask.java:308)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$301(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:180)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:294)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
2016-10-18 15:38:52,495 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 ERROR      [atlassian.jira.cluster.OfBizMessageHandlerService] There was a problem handling a cluster message
java.lang.RuntimeException: com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IndexException: Failed to acquire reindex lock
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService$MessageConsumer.restoreIndex(DefaultIndexCopyService.java:179)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService$MessageConsumer.receive(DefaultIndexCopyService.java:195)
...
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IndexException: Failed to acquire reindex lock
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.recoverIndexFromBackup(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:126)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService$MessageConsumer.restoreIndex(DefaultIndexCopyService.java:175)
	... 12 more
{code}
 
h3. Notes
This specific error was caused by bug in *Structure* 3.3.1 and fixed in *3.3.3* ([Structure+3.3.3+Release+Notes|https://wiki.almworks.com/display/structure/Structure+3.3.3+Release+Notes]). {color:red}All JIRA DC clients should update to latest Structure.{color}
See related suggested ticket to improve logging: JRA-63188
Almworks refactored the code in  *Structure* 3.4 and switched to _optimistic locking_ (no lock is held). That should prevent other lock related problems in the future. 

h3.Workaround
* Start disable plugins one by one and restart JIRA each time. 

h3. Note on Won't Fix
Update: 2017-04-20
Dev team reviewed the bug and at this point implementing proper fix (_introducing timeout_ to plugin operation) will be time consuming and risky as it could damage JIRA index if we were to interrupt plugin.
Following changes related to this problem were done:
* Almworks changed their code in *Structure* and switched to optimistic locking
* Additional logging were implemented and enabled by default in recent version of JIRA (see JRASERVER-63188)

With all that being said, we decided that we stop working on this and mark it as _Won't Fix_. We will reopen it if problem reoccurs and gets more traction.
fields.summary: JIRA is not able to obtain DefaultIndexManager write lock due to plugin holding it

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63188].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently when JIRA needs to work with Lucene index (Full locked reindex, apply index snapshot, apply index from another node in JDC), it need to get the *indexLock.writeLock* in the {{withReindexLock}} method. 

If system is busy or some of componets forget to release the lock, you will get and exception:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
2016-10-18 15:38:51,732 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 ERROR      [jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Wait attempt timed out - waited 60000 milliseconds
com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IndexException: Wait attempt timed out - waited 60000 milliseconds
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.obtain(DefaultIndexManager.java:936)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.access$900(DefaultIndexManager.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager$IndexLock.tryLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:1298)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.withReindexLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:375)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.recoverIndexFromBackup(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:124)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService$MessageConsumer.restoreIndex(DefaultIndexCopyService.java:175)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService$MessageConsumer.receive(DefaultIndexCopyService.java:195)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.OfBizMessageHandlerService.sendLocalFromNode(OfBizMessageHandlerService.java:260)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.OfBizMessageHandlerService.handleReceivedMessages(OfBizMessageHandlerService.java:153)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.OfBizMessageHandlerService.access$000(OfBizMessageHandlerService.java:34)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.OfBizMessageHandlerService$1.run(OfBizMessageHandlerService.java:59)

	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.runAndReset(FutureTask.java:308)

The current export feature only includes internal issue links but not external links to other applications, such as Confluence. This is due to the fact that the export depends on the *columns* selected, which do not include external links.

This could cause issues to customers depending on several *applications* within their organization as it could lead to discrepancies.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a project containing *versions* with a *start date* set
# Create a *XML Backup* of this instance.
# Import the *Backup* into a *fresh* instance. 

h3. Expected Results
JIRA imports the project with the *versions* as they were in the *source* (with the start date)

h3. Actual Results
JIRA *imports* the project *BUT* the versions do NOT include the *start dates*

h3. Notes
The version start dates are actually imported correctly at first, but then after import they get removed again towards the end of the import.

h3. Workaround
Run the following SQL query on source database:
{code}select concat('update projectversion set startdate = ''',startdate,''' where id = ',id,';') from projectversion where startdate is not null;
{code}
This would generate a set of update queries that you can execute on target instance post-import to fix the versions.
* If you no longer have access to the source database, you may be lucky enough to get this same information from the import database by running the SQL query as soon as the entities.xml import is complete at the 90% import mark before the data gets removed again somewhere in the last 10% portion of the import. This can be tricky if you're doing a tiny import that moves along very quickly.
fields.summary: Restoring XML backup does not import project version's Start Date

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JVM instability at one node affects whole JIRA datacenter cluster. It is possible that an OOME causes the entire cluster down.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA datacenter with multiple nodes
 *Node A* hammered by memory intensive operations until it gets into OOME state. However, at this state node is not technically down and still registered as an 'Active' member in the cluster but not processing request either other than Garbage Collection.
 *Node B* still consider node *A* as 'Active' so it kept performing cache synchronisation to Node A which not responding to the request and put Node B in stale position. 

h3. Diagnostic 

Node B's thread dump shows lots of thread performing cache sync
{code:java}
"RMI TCP Connection(401971)-10.50.226.97" #1309319 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f0f2c048000 nid=0x1447b runnable [0x00007f0ee8338000] java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
 at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
 at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead(SocketInputStream.java:116)
 at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:170)
 at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:141)
 at java.io.BufferedInputStream.fill(BufferedInputStream.java:246)
 at java.io.BufferedInputStream.read(BufferedInputStream.java:265) - locked <0x000000051a686650> (a java.io.BufferedInputStream)
 at java.io.FilterInputStream.read(FilterInputStream.java:83)
 at sun.rmi.transport.tcp.TCPTransport.handleMessages(TCPTransport.java:550)
 at sun.rmi.transport.tcp.TCPTransport$ConnectionHandler.run0(TCPTransport.java:826)
 at sun.rmi.transport.tcp.TCPTransport$ConnectionHandler.lambda$run$79(TCPTransport.java:683)
 at sun.rmi.transport.tcp.TCPTransport$ConnectionHandler$$Lambda$3/349671394.run(Unknown Source)
 at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
 at sun.rmi.transport.tcp.TCPTransport$ConnectionHandler.run(TCPTransport.java:682)
 at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
 at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
{code}
h3. Expected 

When a node goes into OOME or other heavy GC loop (hence not processing request) it should be evicted out of cluster other nodes not affected.
h3. Actual

Node B can hang
h3. Workaround

Restart/shutdown node that is hitting into OOME
fields.summary: JVM instability at one node affects whole JIRA datacenter cluster

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a project has a Category associated with it, there should be a section of the *Project Summary : Activity* screen which shows the Category. 

However, this last worked in JIRA 6.4.x; starting in JIRA 7.0.0 and above, the Category no longer shows in the *Project Summary : Activity* screen.

In order to determine the Category, you would need to *View All Projects* from the *Projects* drop down menu, which has a column which shows the Category.

*+JIRA 6.4.14+* 
Admin Summary:
 !6.4.14_Admin_Summary.png|thumbnail! 

Project Summary:
 !6.4.14_Project_Summary.png|thumbnail! 


*+JIRA 7.0.0+*
Admin Summary:
 !7.0.0_Admin_Summary.png|thumbnail! 

Project Summary *(Missing Category)*:
 !7.0.0_Project_Summary.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Environment
JIRA 7.0.0 +

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. As a project administrator, set a *Category* in the *Project Administration : Summary* screen
2. Navigate to the *Project Summary : Activity* screen

h3. Expected Results

There should be a section which shows the Category in the screen

h3. Actual Results

This section is missing.

h3.Workaround

In order to determine the Category, you would need to *View All Projects* from the *Projects* drop down menu, which has a column which shows the Category.

JIRA Service Desk Customers that don't have application access to JIRA and only have the 'Restricted portal access' flag can be assigned to issues on JIRA Software projects.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA executes unnecessary ALTER TABLE operation for AO tables related to plugin during plugin install / upgrade / uninstall / initialisation and also during JIRA restart. If AO table has a lot of data, this will slow down JIRA start-up or plugin initialization significantly and cause application to stall.
Problem has specific conditions for some DB:
* Problem with MySQL DB and specific tables with _LONGTEXT_ columns
* Problem with Oracle, specific tables with _NUMBER(20,0) DEFAULT 0_ and _DOUBLE PRECISION_ columns
* Problem with MSSQL, conditions <TDB>

h3. Environment
This is example for MySQL, for other DB please use corresponding conditions:
 * JIRA
 * MySQL DB
 * Some plugins creating table with _LONGTEXT_ columns: eg: DVCS, webhook

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup JIRA with mentioned enviroment
 # Enable AO debug logging or MySQL all log
 # Restart JIRA

JIRA doesn't do unnecessary table modification. JIRA s

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63125].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Activity stream that has a filter to show comments will only show x% of updates from today and then move to yesterday if the limit is too small to show both.

h3. Suggested Solution
All latest comments should show in activity stream gadgets even if limit is too small
fields.summary: Latest comments should show in activity stream gadgets even if limit is too small

h3. Problem Definition
Loading a filter with *savedfilter* query is slow as it needs to retrieve information from another filter.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Improve the load time when loading a filter with *savedfilter* query

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63123].
  {panel}

+Issue Summary+

When searching for an issue in JIRA using the advanced JQL search option, clicking on an option would have no effect in Chrome browser.

+Environment Summary+

|JIRA Version|JIRA Server 7.1.9, 7.2.4|
|Browser|Chrome|
|Operating System|Windows|

+Steps to Reproduce+

# Go to {{Issues > Search for Issues}} page.
# Switch the JQL option to Advanced Search.
# Start searching for something like project and when the option is shown, use your mouse to select the option rather than using the keyboard.

+Expected Behavior+

JIRA would complete the search.

+Actual Behavior+

Nothing happens when you click on the option.

(i) Tested this on chromium also on Linux operating system and other browsers on Windows and it works as intended.
fields.summary: Clicking on option Not working during Advanced Search

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Issue Statistics gadget used to wrap text on the statistic type field, but this appears to be broken in JIRA 7 and beyond.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project with max character name
# Create an issue in this project
# Create a dashboard with the Issue Statistics gadget
# Configure this gadget to show Project as the statistic type and set the filter to display the project created in step 1
# Save and view the dashboard

h3. Expected Results
The text in the Project field should wrap.

h3. Actual Results
The text in the Project field does not wrap and requires users to scroll to view all statistucs.
fields.summary: Issues statistics gadget no longer wraps statistic type field text

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63121].
  {panel}

Creating this ticket to track issue reported on iOS app.
  
  
  Hi!

I use a business board with the columns (in order) backlog, in progress, done and deferred. But in the JIRA Cloud app for iOS the order is different. Then its backlog, deferred, in progress and done. How do I solve it?

Thank you,

/Johan
fields.summary: Reordering of core boards columns does not reflect on JIRA app
